repnme.cdata!: India - Bombay High Offshore Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project consists of the construction
            of the facilities required to produce up to 140,000 barrels
            per day of oil and 2.2 million cubic meters per day of
            natural gas from the Bombay Highand Bassein oil and gas
            fields, located about 160 km and 100 km, respectively, west
            of Bombay, in the Arabian Sea, and construction of
            facilities to process, transport, store and deliver to users
            the oil and natural gas expected to be available from these
            fields at full production.
